Reviews.Title: Go with Samsung TV's.  You won't regret it
Reviews.Author: M. Phares "mmphares"
Reviews.Content: I picked up this TV from Circuit City just before Labor Day.  It is basically the same spec-wise as the 650 series. The only differences are 1 less HDMI port (3 instead of 4),  a contrast ration of 40,000:1 rather than 50,000:1 and no infolink.  For those who don't know, Infolink allows you to hook up the internet to the back of your tv via an ethernet jack.  You are then able to pull up news, weather, and stock info from USA Today.  This is all it lets you do though. Infolink does not allow you to download firmware, view web pages or anything like that.  This is a great TV.  120Hz is amazing.  It almost make it seem like the characters are right there in the room with you when you are watching blu-ray movies.  The quality picture is great, the menu system looks nice and is easy to use, and for those who like lots of control over picture settings, to get their picture just right, this tv has a ton of different adjustable setting options, allowing you to adjust the backlight level, the black level, 120Hz processing level, gamma, white space, color space, color, contrast, brighness, sharpness, defeatable edge enhancement, and more

Reviews.Title: Amazing Quality
Reviews.Author: nuts about music
Reviews.Content: Wow. This is a beautiful set - image quality is stellar - off-air and dvd source, 480, 720, 1080 all great.  D-TV signals are amazing. Even stronger analog (i.e. old style NTSC) off-air signals look great. Audio clear and accurate. I've had it about a week and first impressions are really strong. Matte finish really helps if placement is near windows. This is a technological marvel. Menu's are clear, features are great, beautiful looking - I have to say touch of color is realllllly subtle, you can pretty much ignore this - it is classy without needing any extra gimmicks like this. Fast action/sports look great. Lots of tweaks to get a picture you will be happy with.It is reasonably light weight, has swivel stand, viewing angle is excellent. It is like a jewel! Extremely well engineered. As of today, I think this set is at a price performance sweet spot. Samsung seems to really understands LCD video. If you are average person trying to find a good panel, you should be very happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality HDTV - Complete satisfaction!
Reviews.Author: JohnD "JohnD212"
Reviews.Content: I originally bought the LN40A550 but after a few weeks I realized I wanted something a little better. I then went with the LN40A630 and I could not be happier. The quality of this tv is top notch. Standard television looks wonderful on it and High Def...well...it takes my breath away. I especially like the AMP feature that helps to eliminate the blur in fast scenes.If you're worried about the touch of color don't even worry...they have all but eliminated the color. I think though it was pretty a lot of people didn't like how pronounced it was. If you're unsure about rather you should buy it or not...I say go for it. Its a quality set and the image it gives off is top notch. I also play Xbox 360 and games look wonderful (only one suggestion...in certain games its best to turn the AMP feature off to help eliminate any lag in controls).Sound has never been HDTV's stronger quality but I have to say that the sound of this set compared to the 550 is much better. You might still want to get external speakers to help when watching tv and movies.

Reviews.Title: I hope I don't take this for granted
Reviews.Author: P. Fugiel
Reviews.Content: I couldn't wait any longer to buy an HDTV and after looking around for the "right" tv after a month I settled on this one as it was on sale at bestbuy for $1399 (cdn).  My goal was to find a TV that could keep up with the industry standard for the next few years (5 at least).  It has the 120hz, the 40,000:1 contrast ratio, 1080p, 3 hdmi's, etc etc.  This TV also has a lightning quick response time compared to other lcds at this price.I am extremely happy with this TV.  Anyone who has seen a movie on it is shocked as to how clear and realistic the picture is.  Actually, my brother said the TV ruins movies because they are presented entirely different with this TV. The TV is so good that it pinpoints the flaws in the CGI of the lord of the rings movies when I play the dvd on my xbox.At the time I am writing this review, this TV has the specs worthy of a $2000 LCD in its class.  In fact, the Samsung 650 is almost $400 more and the specs are almost entirely the same  (the screen is made from a different material).  Samsung is also the industry leader in LCD technology.  I highly recommend this TV, and I agree with the earlier reviewer that it is set at an optimal price/performance position.  For what you get and what you pay, this TV can not be beat at this time.

Reviews.Title: Compare this Samsung to my Sony Bravia XBR 46"  Model: KDL-46XBR4
Reviews.Author: J M "Jack"
Reviews.Content: To be clear, if there were the opportunity to give this Samsung LN40A630 a four and a half star, that's what I would have chosen. I really debated about getting this Samsung versus the Sony Bravia XBR KDL-40XBR6 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV. We already own the Sony Bravia XBR 46" model KDL-46XBR4 and are THRILLED with that TV. Since I was already a fan of Sony, I tried to research whether the few hundred $$ in savings would be worth it if the picture didn't compare to what I was used to with the Sony, and now they are up to XBR6 versus 4. Side by side in a brick and mortar store, the Samsung and the Sony 40XBR6 were practically identical. Of course real world testing is impossible when they are playing a specific video and you are limited to what they are showing you. I went ahead and bought the Samsung LN40A630 from Amazon (great delivery, no problems whatsoever). I performed some color correction with the Samsung's vast amount of color controls. I perform graphic color correction for a living so it is with a highly critical eye that I was judging picture quality and color. Once I was happy with the correction I DVR recorded "LOST" on both TVs. Then in I viewed various scenes on both TVs. For the most part the picture was pretty comparable. I will describe a few differences in my opinion: Our Sony has more of a cinematic feel in the picture most likely because of deeper blacks and it handles banding (abrupt change in shades of the same color) better. In various scenes, the Samsung almost took on a video effect. The clarity and sharpness is profound, but that sometimes gave it a more stark effect. This happened in only some scenes. For the most part the pictures were very comparable. I would imagine for those of you who enjoy football games, this may be an asset. Lest you think I am not pleased with the TV, I am really happy with it. It's got wonderful quality and richness in the picture. The sound is not as good as our Sony because the speakers are on the bottom of the TV as opposed to front facing. But the sound is good enough for sure. I would find it hard to believe anyone would regret this TV. I am a harsh critic. I think most people (and they have) would review this as a 5 star TV. I think I still prefer the Sony, but this Samsung sure gives it a run for it's money. As far as the "touch of red", it is far less red than the glossy screened version of this TV. I happened to like the red, so I was a little disappointed to see it basically looks black. Again, that may be a positive to someone else. Even in bright sunlight, this TV frame pretty much looks black. On the plus side, I think this set is far more attractive than the Sony I was thinking of purchasing. Clean lines, attractive finish. This set is also far less expensive to mount on the wall. We purchased the Peerless PA740 Articulating Wall Mount for 22-inch to 40 inch flat panel displays (Amazon). Only $68 with free shipping and it can move in pretty much any direction. To mount the Sony we would have had to buy a different kind of mount with an adapter, all adding up to more than quadruple the mounting costs.ADDENDUM 5/23/09: We have had this TV for several months now. Changed my review from 4 stars to 5. I may only buy Samsungs moving forward. Just as great as Sony, lower cost than Sony.

Reviews.Title: A Gamer's Dream
Reviews.Author: Sprinkles
Reviews.Content: I've been an avid gamer since I was 8 years old. I've been wanting a new HDTV for about a year now, but I wanted to make sure to get one that could handle all my consoles, as well a kick-butt movie machine. This TV has blown me away.Both my 360 and PS3 are hooked up via HDMI and the picture is drop-dead GORGEOUS. Games can really take full advantage of the optimal picture quality, plus the 120hz motion plus makes them run like butter. One thing I notice in particular is the HUD on all my games, which is clear as day. On my previous HDTV (an LG tube) it was very difficult to read any kind of corner maps, see how much ammo I had left, or even tell how much life I had left. Now that I have this television, there is no way I can go back.This TV has wowed us ever since we brought it home, and it continues to surprise us. If you're on the fence about this particular television, let me assure you that there is nothing to worry about. You will be amazed!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful image quality, lacking on functionality
Reviews.Author: J. M. Wurmser
Reviews.Content: ***UPDATE: after three years of great performance, the TV all of a sudden started showing red "waves" on the screen, mostly where black colors show up.  After doing some research online, this appears to be a common problem and costly to fix.  Taking it in for repair, will update as things develop.***ORIGINAL REVIEW:After conducting exhaustive research for my new 1080p TV to watch Blu-Rays on, I found the 630 to be the best value for money out there (as of feb-2009).  Image quality is every bit as good as others say, DVDs look crisp and bright.  The 630 series has the semi-matte finish which works great for me because the room is brightly lit and would be impossible to watch on the reflective screens on the 650 series and the like.  Strongly recommend this feature if your room has lots of light.As an image panel, it works beautifully.  The only reason I'm not awarding it 5 stars is because it lacks some basic TV functionality:1. It doesn't have a Sleep feature, which I sorely miss.2. It takes about 2-3 seconds to turn on/off and has a little sound effect, which is also disturbing when someone in the room is sleeping.3. The remote must be pointed exactly at the "eye" at the correct angle or it won't respond.  Very annoying.4. When the unit is off, it has a red light next to the on/off button which is annoying if you have the TV in your room.Overall I still consider the image quality to be worth putting up with the hindrances.  But if I had paid attention to the problems with the TV functionality itself, I might have picked another TV.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is amazing
Reviews.Author: F. Reeves "PS3 deal"
Reviews.Content: For years I didn't understand the big deal regarding HD. I finally decided to get an HDTV in December. In 3 weeks time I had two 1080p LCDs without 120hz. The picture quality of those sets on HD were good but not worth shelling out $1K for a TV.  And standard def was horrible. So after not being satisfied I decided to spend a little more since i figured I would be keeping this tv for 3-5 years. My choice was the Vizio 42" with 120hz and Samsung A500.  Both had similar picture quality and the price was the same. Luckily I noticed that the A630 was on sale at circuit city for under $1K. I decided to give it a try. SD looks good. HD looks great. Blu ray looks breathtaking. I bought dark knight on blu ray and the scenes shot in HD (i.e. the first scene with the bank robbers) the buildings looks like your actually there. 120hz takes awhile to get used to because it takes the grainy look from film and makes the picture clear. Luckily you can adjust the 120hz to off, low, medium,high.  The only problem I have is the PIP. While the split screen effect is a great feature you cant watch two digital signals. The PIP is angalog.  I realize another tuner would be required for that function. But at least the PIP could handle DVD or PS3.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: A Reader
Reviews.Content: I spent about 3 weeks shopping and researching before I bought this TV.  I narrowed it down to the Samsung and the Sony Bravia "W" series, but after watching the two side by side at a store decided I liked the Samsung picture better.  I've now had the 630 for two weeks, and it's terrific.  Very easy to set up -- it takes a couple of days with the remote to figure everything out but it's all intuitive so you eventually get there.  The picture is fantastic.  At first, my wife complained that it could be too good, making some shows look overly detailed and thus artificial, but this problem went away when I figured out that you can change the picture on the remote from "cool" to "warm."  Overall I've been extremely pleased with the picture -- the HD is fantastic and regular TV also looks better.  Watching basketball in particular is a whole new experience. The sound quality is good, but you'll need to add a sound system for it to match the picture quality.  My only complaint is that sometimes I need to re punch in the input source on the remote after I turn it on (i.e., from TV to satellite), which only takes a second but is irritating nonetheless.  Overall, though, I highly recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV at an amazing price.
Reviews.Author: Peter F. Mckenzie "mckenzievideo"
Reviews.Content: I am an avid video guru who is obsessed with quality.  I have been actively searching for the perfect flat panel LCD to replace a 5 year old tube Sony CRT.The Samsung LN40A630 is by far one of the best LCD TV's on the market.  The 120Hz at first was a bit distracting.  After bumping it down to the 'low' setting, I was very impressed.  The richness of the color and the quality of the blacks is just right.The TV has a very aesthetically pleasing bezel around the border which allows for your eyes to focus in on the TV.3 HDMI inputs is more than enough for our home.  We have a Cable Set Top Box which is outputting HDMI via 720p and 1080i.  The quality is very clean.  We also have an XBOX 360 and PS3 outputting 1080p.  I can say that the 1080p makes a huge difference.Blu ray on this TV takes the movie watching experience to a whole other level.The only thing I would recommend in addition is a 5.1 surround sound system.  The sound quality on any LCD is not going to be that great.I am so pleased with this TV.  I bought it from HHGREGG for $1099 which is $100 less than what Amazon is selling it for.  Great deal!If you are in the market for a flat panel LCD that is not too big, this is the TV for you.  Samsung makes the best LCD's out there.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40a630, great Amazon service
Reviews.Author: Ron Wong
Reviews.Content: Good TV but had a bad tuner, Amazon replaced right away. Better service than in a bricks and mortar store

Reviews.Title: real please
Reviews.Author: Delmar James
Reviews.Content: really pleased with this Samsung 40". The only thing I would probably not include I I had it to do over would be the 120 HZ for $300.00 more.  Other than that I am very pleased.I ordered on a monday and it came on Thursday of the same week by Pilot freight line right to my front door. They unloaded it, unpackaged it and checked it out.Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great for sports fans!!
Reviews.Author: N John
Reviews.Content: We are really happy with this Samsung television.  It's a great size and the 120hz make it great for watching sports. (It has different e-modes for sports, movies and games)  The non-reflective screen makes for good viewing in our family room, which has lots of windows.  It was easy to set up. We have it in a built in - so it's not installed on any walls.

Reviews.Title: great purchase!
Reviews.Author: happy customer "Sue"
Reviews.Content: I chose this LCD flat screen by researching Consumer Reports and then watching the holiday sales for the best price. Amazon.com had the best price I saw for this particular Samsung model.  There were lower prices on other flat screens, but the quality of the picture and ease of use of this one make it worth paying a little more. Vann's was the store that it was actually shipped from and it arrived in perfect condition, as well as within the date range that they gave me at the time of purchase. Beats having to drive to the store,deal with sales people, then load and unload your car. I would definitely purchase electronics through Amazon.com again.  So easy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Phet Vongsavanh "bucphet"
Reviews.Content: My wife remodel the living room and it looked great except for that tube 32 inch-Zenith (love the tV, but too big) that took up the whole living room.  So my wife gave me permission to buy an LCD.  I started out wanting the biggest, so I bought a Panasonic Plasma 50" 1080P but it was too big for my living room and the picture did not appear all that clear.  I paid  $1499 for it.  I was still unsatisfied so I returned it and bought this TV.  This TV definitely is worth the hype, the pictures are so clear and the 120 hz is great for Football.  It looks great in my living room.I had it for 2 weeks and could not be happier.  You cannot go wrong with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Novice Review
Reviews.Author: C. White "Golfguy"
Reviews.Content: After a couple of months of research I finally made a decision and bought this TV. I was looking for the best technology for the money and for what I really need (not being an audiophile) this has impressed both my Wife and I tremendously.I was able to find it locally at national chain for $1099 on sale which was the lowest I had seen and I felt a good price given I purchased it before Xmas.  I hooked up a Panasonic Blue Ray disk player,Panasonic DMP-BD35K 1080p Blu-ray Player and the picture quality floored me. It was easy to set up and tweak to get th epicture the way I liked it.I chose this model over the 650 because of the matte finish of the screen which works well in my bright Family Room.I think for the money, and after researching this thing for a while, you'd be hard pressed to find a better total package.  My next purchase is a Home Theater system and I can't wait to see this package in action!

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality and features at a great price.. - Go for it!!
Reviews.Author: Santhosh "Santhosh"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV which has all the required features (1080p, 3 HDMI inputs, 120 Hz processing). Compared with LN40a650 it has one less HDMI port and has no info link (which is one of those fancy features with not much use). Also the touch of color design in LN40a650 has a more prominent red color panel which is not for everyone. Another significant difference is ln40a630 has matte finish screen where was 650 has glossy finish. I was specifically looking for matte finish because it doesn't reflect light from the room. And 630 is cheaper than 650. So whats not to like about 630 ? I got it from Fry's in Sunnyvale for $1099/- which is a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk after 3 years
Reviews.Author: frustrated
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN40A630 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color I worked really hard to find a TV like this and really felt good about it until a few weeks ago when the screen went blank in the middle of a football game.  Samsung sent a guy out to see if it was the capacitors, which I guess can blow on this bird.  Instead the guy said it was the T-con, and recommended I trash the TV.  So I am doing that now - don't buy this thing unless you are prepared to shell out some big bucks in a couple of years, of course just beyond warranty.

Reviews.Title: It's as good as it gets!
Reviews.Author: Linda M. Wilt "s husband"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my husband and this is his review:I researched for months and got the 40A630 a week ago. Everything about the delivery from Amazon and the TV is perfect.  The reviews I saw indicated that this is the right TV to get and they were right.  No glare issues, good off-axis viewing, The actors look 3D when viewing high def signals from my roof top antenna (the best viewing other than blu-ray), and the plentiful picture controls allows for tweaking the picture for any programming. the sound is just OK, This TV replaced a Samsung 32" 720P LCD tv that had a very good picture, but the new 40A630 has twice the picture quality.  On my Xbox 360 you can get head shots all the way across a valley.  I was using my old 32" Sammmy LCD for a computer monitor, but when I switched to using the new 40A630 as a computer monitor.... well let's just say that once you go 1080P you willnever go back.

Reviews.Title: samsung LN40A630
Reviews.Author: L. Moore
Reviews.Content: Delivery was great just 4 days and the TV was set up by delivery team. Great picture only disapointing thing is picture in picture does not work for second broadcast so you can not use it for two ballgames at the same time. (which is the only reason I can see for having it).

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40A630 40-inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: Richard Stcyr
Reviews.Content: What a great product! The picture is crystal clear and the 120HZ does make a big difference. Even my old DVD player looks better. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40A630 review
Reviews.Author: C. Wyckoff
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv for the money.  I compare this tv to a 42 Plasma Panasonic Viera that I've owned for about 3 years.  I would rate the Viera slightly better as the Samsung still has a little bit of blur on fast action like sports.  There are a lot of configuration options so maybe I haven't got it perfect yet.  I do watch blue rays at 1080p and 24 frames and I would say that looks better on the Samsung then it does on my Viera which can't do 24 frames.  I have the same blu ray player on each tv, Samsung BPD 1500 I believe.  I am very picky and even with the slight blur on fast motion, I'd still get the tv again and rate it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great TV..
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV very long back and has been working without any issues. Good picture quality and looks good design wise. Overall a happy customer :)

Reviews.Title: good but flawed
Reviews.Author: dococt168
Reviews.Content: After three months of having the product the picture began to have defects. they would go away after a few seconds but seconds turned into minutes and minutes into hours. It cost me $200 to fix it. I probably won't buy a TV off of the internet again unless it is brand new.

Reviews.Title: ghosting
Reviews.Author: CA-Z
Reviews.Content: After 2 1/4 yrs. half of the picture will ghost for 15-20 minutes.  Samsung appvd repairman says he MAY be able to repair it for $275, then warrantee it for 90 days.  If he cannot fix it, no charge.  Real nice of him.  Other repair shops say that it's a Samsung & Sony prob. and must replace the screen, w/no guarantee it'll work.I'm too disapointed to try it.  Consequently, this will be my last fling with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: 2 years later, the tv has stopped working
Reviews.Author: Kim "KIM"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv 2 years and 3 months ago.  Its a great tv, the size, the sound, except it now doesn't work.  The tv now shuts itself off then on then off then on and will suddenly blast out a loud decimal pitched noise.  I did some research and found that this is a known issue that happens with Samsung.  Would I buy this tv again?  Probably not, I would spend the extra money on a Sony but then there may be issues there as well.  I still love Samsung just suggesting one researches for issues as well as what works well and is a best seller.  Thanks,

Reviews.Title: great T.V
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I was looking for  a tv for my sun room and decided on a lcd instead of the plasma, lcd are brighter.  I am very pleased with this tv.  Picture quality and sound are second to none.  I did not go with the glossy screen I was concerned with the reflection form all the windows.  I can watch this tv any time of day with the curtains open.  The only problem is when I first turned it on there was a dead pixel running from the top of the screen to the bottom.  I called samsung and they sent someone out to pick it up a day later.  I had to be there of course and had it fixed 2 days later, I decided to pick it up myself since I couldn't be there when they were going to deliver it.  It inconvienient but it didn't cost me anything to get it fixed.  The HD is amazing and will never go back to standard.  The colors are enhanced and are great for watching sports.  I think samsung is the only one to enhance colors, I like it others may not.  Go to the store a compare the screens side by side and decide for yourself.  I have had this tv for over two years and have had no problems other than when I first pulled it out of the box.  I love this tv and would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Martin Andersen "mandersen"
Reviews.Content: TV is fabulous! Color, HD picture, ease of use, all great. Easy to set up. I have surround sound so never really paid attention to sound without it. Delivery was right on time and in home. Great TV. Great price.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Christopher C. Brown "photoCb"
Reviews.Content: Before I start I like to state that the ware house sent me a updated model.  From A630 to a B630 for the same price that the tv cost due to low inventory.  So I got a good deal.  By far the tv is wounderful it's terrific playing blu-Ray and playing video games on my PS3 slim.  Now the only issue that I will complain about which at first but not anymore because the problem is fixed now.  I did noticed when I be watching a movie at 24hz or 24 fps.  I saw alot of ghosting going on in action scenes in movies.  But I fixed this problem.  What I did is very simple I went to video settings and turned off the bluray 24hz.  So that way the PS3 can play the movie at 60hz.  This will eliminate the ghosting effect by 2/3rds maybe more.  Now I don't see it anymore.  So I can watch my movies in 120hz by selecting the motion sensor on CLEAR.  Standard or Smooth is to much.  I recomend this tv or the later series Samsungs is a great brand.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Steven Jay Davis
Reviews.Content: Not much to say. Great price. Great picture quality. Not feeling the 120hz. It looks sped up and gives me a headache. I turned it off. Other than that, it's awesome! Buy it now! :)

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: Alex J. Zlakowski IV
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this TV to anyone looking to purchase a HD TV.  Easy to set up and a wide variety of settings to get the best picture.

Reviews.Title: This set rocks!
Reviews.Author: Bill H.
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about Samsung, while doing comparisons in the Fall of 2008 Samsung had the edge on all other brands.  I put a fence around mine to keep the kids away.  The size is truly all you need too many people are buying sets that are too large for thier space and just a burden on the pocketbook.  Be realistic and buy quality over quantity like I did.

Reviews.Title: Samsung - Red Touch of Color
Reviews.Author: M. Rohde
Reviews.Content: We have several LCD TVs and by far the Samsung has the clearest picture. We selected this model because of its unique size for a 40-inch TV that fit perfectly in our space.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous image!
Reviews.Author: Harvey L. "Harvey L."
Reviews.Content: Having upgraded to Verizon FiOS, I decided to take advantage of its HD capability, even though my 15 year old Philips TV was still working fine. I wanted to buy an HDTV just once (I am over 70), so I got this one, which Consumer Reports currently rates highest among 40-inch LCD models. This was a little larger than I had originally intended to buy, but smaller ones lacked features (like 120 Hz) that I wanted, although I am sure they will have them in the future. The image is really beautiful--crisp, beautiful color (without altering any of the factory settings). One of CR's points that clinched the deal for me was the hi-fi sound from this TV's internal speakers. My old TV played through my (also aging) stereo system; its internal speakers were sort of tinny-sounding.As for the "red touch of color" on the frame, it is scarcely noticeable and should not really enter into anyone's decision, pro or con, regarding purchase of this model. I don't know why they bother putting it in; as far as anyone can tell, the border is black, period.My only concern at this point, a month or so after installation, is a single green dot of light that appears in the lower left area whenever the TV is on, whether receiving a signal or not. It is not really annoying, but I am hoping there won't be more of them in the future. I'll be calling Samsung to find out whether this point of light can be eliminated.

Reviews.Title: Luv my TV!!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Aitson
Reviews.Content: I love my TV! We just had it for about wk now. The picture is perfect! my husband and I shopped for a while and looked up info. about LCD TV's! We just wanted to make sure we get our moneys worth. Samsung is really the best! my parents and my brother have other brands, but this LCD's picture experience is the best!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful New TV
Reviews.Author: Carol C. Bray
Reviews.Content: Our new Samsung flat-screen TV is just marvelous.  My son-in-law researched and researched the product and his work paid off.  The clarity of the picture is just superb.  The delivery men set up the TV for me.  How grateful I was for personal attention. Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: samsung tv
Reviews.Author: enigma "NMG"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for our bedroom -- it's awesome !!!!! The picture quality is great - i have it hooked up to Comcast HD box and a Samsung blue-ray player.  Excellent color and sound - would recommend this highly!!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40 inch LCD
Reviews.Author: Speedy "Sunny"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on Amazon's site via ButterflyPhoto. A cosmetic defect caused a return and the most discouraging experience ensued ending up with Amazon coming to the rescue in getting my money back. The Amazon Customer Service representatives handled this matter with real concern for the customer. I did not have much viewing time with this TV. However, while I had it the picture was great with Blu Ray and HD DVD. The cable experience was not much more than average, but this TV has many adjustments that could improve that situation. Overall it's a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Oak Gal
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at first purchasing a TV through the mail.  But at the price it was going for, I had to try it.  It arrived in excellent condition from a carrier.  It was easy to set up, too.  Great picture/sound....

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Thom in San Diego
Reviews.Content: I purchased this based on its great reviews and these are justified.  The picture quality on high definition sources is fantastic.  I also purchased it because it has a relatively narrow bevel - so it gave me a 40" picture in my limited space.  This set fits in my home entertainment center perfectly.  The touch of red is very subtle on this TV.  The sound quality is quite good for regular TV.  I use my receiver and external speakers for movies.  I highly recommend the TV

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40'' LN40A630
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Rene "Camera Buff"
Reviews.Content: Excellent sharp picture. No blurring on motion. Have only had product 2 weeks but thus far very satisfied

Reviews.Title: TV is shot in less than two years
Reviews.Author: Montanan
Reviews.Content: We originally bought this TV because of its good reviews (purchased at Sears).  We have been satisfied with it till recently, although I felt it was overpriced - very little difference from lower priced brands.  However, a couple of months ago the TV developed four white lines across the screen, for about the first half hour after the TV is turned on, along with ghost images and text on the screen.  They eventually go away after half an hour.  The TV is half a year past the warranty period. We live near a small town, a long way from qualified TV repair centers.  We will probably just run it till it quits (which judging from the picture, may not be long). We will never buy another Samsung product and recommend you don't either.  $[...] bucks down the drain!

Reviews.Title: Great Satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Smith
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the LCD TV.  Picture is great as is the sound.  It also looks good in the room where it is placed.

Reviews.Title: RATING FOR ELECTRONICS EXPO
Reviews.Author: Thomas P. Cosgrove
Reviews.Content: Due to a misunderstanding between myself and a customer interface, I gave Electronics Expo a very low rating.  After further contact with their customer service dept., this supplier met all of my expectations with full satisffaction.  I would not hesitate to do business with this supplier again.
